Qst.Quest: the steps, if any, that are being taken to further investigate the cluster of cancer deaths (details supplied) in County Wicklow with a view to determining if there is a connection between these deaths and radiation or fallout from Sellafield or Chernobyl; and if he will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Health (Mr. Howlin) Brendan Howlin
Speaker.P: The Deputy will be aware of the extreme difficulties involved in demonstrating a definitive casual link between unusual clusters of illness and particular sources of environmental contamination. I am determined, however, that unusual clusters of illnesses or disease particularly those involving birth defects, serious illness or death should be thoroughly investigated by our public health doctors. I am advised that an investigation is being undertaken by the Board in the area of County Wicklow referred to in the newspaper article submitted by the Deputy. When the health board has completed its report I will give it careful consideration.

MainHeading.Title: Written Answers. - Services for the Disabled.

Qst.Quest: the number of people with a disability who are awaiting the provision of a service; if he will give a breakdown of the numbers waiting for residential care, day places or other services; and when adequate provision of services will be more available to people with a disability.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Health (Mr. Howlin) Brendan Howlin
Speaker.P: Information currently available suggests that about 1,300 people with a mental handicap are waiting for residential services and 1,500 for day services. Additional funding of £12.5m is being provided for the development of mental handicap services in 1994. As in previous years, this funding will be allocated following consultation with the regional co-ordinating committees and will be used to provide, inter alia, additional residential and day places.

In regard to people with a physical or sensory disability detailed information of the kind requested by the Deputy is not collected by my Department as a matter of routine. However, it is planned to establish a national database on persons with a physical or sensory disability and this matter is being examined by the Review Group on Physical and Sensory Disability.

I am committed to improving the provision of health services for people with a disability and will examine how this can best be achieved in the light of the recommendations of the Review Group whose final report will be published later this year.

MainHeading.Title: Written Answers. - Report on Women Academics in Third Level Education.

Qst.Quest: her views on the recommendations in the 1987 report of the committee on the position of women academics in third level education; and the measures, if any, she has taken to have these recommendations implemented.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Ms Bhreathnach) Niamh Bhreathnach
Speaker.P: The recommendations in the report referred to by the Deputy were aimed at identifying measures to redress the imbalance in relation to the position of women academics and were intended for implementation by the higher education institutions.

The report was published by the Higher Education Authority and since its publication the Higher Education Authority, in conjuction with UCC, has established a National Centre for Equality in Higher Education at UCC. This centre is concerned with promoting equality in higher education.

Some progress has been made in this area but much remains to be done as indicated in the Green Paper “Education for a Changing World” and in the report on the National Education Convention. The concerns expressed will be considered further in the context of the forthcoming White Paper.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Ms Bhreathnach) Niamh Bhreathnach

MainHeading.Title: Written Answers. - Dungloe (Donegal) Physical Education Hall.

Qst.Quest: in view of the inadequate facilities for physical education at Pobal Scoil Na Rosann, Dungloe, County Donegal, the progress, if any, which has been made with regard to the provision of a physical education hall.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Ms Bhreathnach) Niamh Bhreathnach
Speaker.P: Because of the financial constraints which have existed for a number of years it has not yet been possible to make funding available for the provision of physical education facilities at Pobal Scoil na Rosann, Dungloe, Co. Donegal.

Due to demands on the capital resources available, priority has been given for some time to the provision of essential teaching spaces. However, physical education facilities are provided in all major new school developments.

The provision of indoor sports accommodation in schools, in the form of a general purpose area at primary level and a hall at second level will resume as soon as pressure on available resources for urgent classroom accommodation has eased. In the meantime, additional emphasis is being placed on the adjacent siting and common use of school and community recreational facilities and schools should make maximum use of other sports facilities in their area.
